title: proudP
description:
Facing urinary symptoms like occasional nighttime trips or weak stream? These can be early signs of prostate changes, impacting 1 in 3 individuals over 50. Early monitoring is essential to keep your options open.
proudP is a home prostate health monitoring app - a discreet, convenient way to track your health, armed with insights that empower informed discussions with your healthcare team. 
Don't wait - check your prostate health now and live your best life with confidence. Take charge with proudP.




◼What Does It Do?
proudP® measures how fast and how much your urine is to aid the assessment of your prostate health by healthcare professionals. Combined with an in-app survey, diary and trend features, proudP® makes for a perfect tool for an at-home personal prostate health monitor. You can also get a complete picture of your bladder habits by recording your fluid intakes and voidings.


◼Use proudP® to:
- Measure the urine flow rate and voided volume 
- Share the data with your urologist for medical consultation
- Self-monitor your bladder pattern and habits 


◼Key Features
- Private & convenient home monitoring 
- AI-based automatic measurement (No more manual collection with a cup!)
- Quantitative results on urine flow rate & voided volume
- Easy data sharing with urologist for medical consultation
- Self tracking with Trends and Diary features
- Recording fluid intakes


——— Disclaimer ———
proudP® is meant for patients over 18 years of age, and is currently designed for use by men.


proudP® is an FDA listed medical device and shall only be used in the United States of America.
However, it is not intended to be, and should not replace professional medical advice, screening, diagnosis, or treatment, the practice of medicine, or the provision of medical care. Please do not rely on the results provided by proudP® to assess your health or replace results provided by conventional uroflowmetry. Consult with your doctor or healthcare professionals in all matters relating to your health.


For more information, please visit www.proudp.com
- Terms of Use: https://www.soundable.health/terms-of-use
- Privacy Policy : https://www.soundable.health/privacy-policy
